fullText: This revival of the Kaufman and Hart comedy feels less like a rediscovery than a confirmation that some things are indeed timeless, even when they probably shouldn't be.
dtliExcerpt: This revival of the Kaufman and Hart comedy feels less like a rediscovery than a confirmation that some things are indeed timeless, even when they probably shouldn't be.
bwwExcerpt: A lot of shows can make you laugh. What's rare is a play that makes you beam from curtain to curtain. Such is the effect of Scott Ellis's felicitous revival of Moss Hart and George S. Kaufman's 1936 comedy about one improbably happy family during the Great Depression...The evening's tone is set and ...
